subject: RE: Transactions in *unit
msgSnippet: Or do you just start a transaction during setUp() and then roll it back during tearDown(), thus magically taking care of all your cleanup? Kevin
messageBody:
Or do you just start a transaction during setUp() and then roll it back
during tearDown(), thus magically taking care of all your cleanup?

Kevin

> -----Original Message-----
> From: Kevin Bourrillion
> Sent: Wednesday, December 27, 2000 11:55 AM
> To: 'junit@egroups.com'
> Subject: Transactions in *unit
>
> Hi all,
>
> This is a great list. I just got on it a few days ago but can already
> tell how useful it will be.
>
> Here's my question for you: are any of you writing tests that require
> explicit transaction management in the test code? What's your policy for
> handling them? Begin and commit within each test case? Verify expected
> results both before and after the commit? Roll back by hand on
> exceptions?
>
> I'd be especially curious to know if you've made any *unit extensions to
> handle the transactions automatically, or even thought much about it.
>
> Thanks a bunch!
> Kevin
>
>
